note:
avatar is a 3D stack of images from a confocal microscope. the image is from a cross-section of part of a dauciform root from a plant found in Western Australia.
"dauciform" because the root hairs are so dense in that particular region that they make the root look like a carrot (Daucus carota). collecting images like this kept me in science all those years.

retired scientist but still dabble, lazy communicator, reader rather than speaker/writer

@rosegwhite in the other place
